title.narrative: OPT 3.3. COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT TO REDUCE, PREVENT AND REPORT VAC

description.narrative: Communities, families, adolescents and children in selected municipalities develop skills to reduce, prevent and report cases of violence, neglect and exploitation., which contributes to Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Innovation, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children and adolescents victims of violence, abuse, neglect and exploitation are protected by functioning systems, policies and a national legal frameork aligned with international standards, including in emergency situations.

related-activity.ref: 0510/A0/05/403 OCM 3. EVERY CHILD IS PROTECTED FROM VIOLENCE AND EXPLOITATION

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Communities, families, adolescents and children in selected municipalities develop skills to reduce, prevent and report cases ofviolence, neglect and exploitation.

description.narrative: 128.279 people, of which 40.181 children and adolescents (20.519 girls, 19.662 boys)increased their knowledge and capacity to prevent, identify and report cases of violence, including sexual violence, and other situations of risk in the family and community during 2021. UNICEF strengthened the capacities of community structures such as Child and Adolescent Committees and recreational associations/clubs, neighbourhood associations and various child and adolescent organizations in both urban and rural areas with a focus on indigenous populations and vulnerable groups. In addition, through the Safe-Family helpline, UNICEF directly supported families at risk or in situations of violence throughout the country. | Status:Met | As-of Date:22/12/2021
